availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edward Wallace, Jr. (Pendleton County, KY, laborer and farmer)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Edward Wallace, Sr., and Isabell Wallace. Married to Elizabeth Woodyard Wallace in Pendleton County, Kentucky, on December 26, 1844. Father of Simeon P. Wallace, Mariah A. Wallace, Nancy Wallace, Sarah E. Wallace, and Martha E. Wallace. Laborer in Pendleton County in 1850. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 1, p. 359A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 448.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Precinct 7, p. 369A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, 1833-1945, Film #000272806, p. 158 of 773 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Pendleton County Wills, vol. 1-4, 1841-1967, p. 42-43, p. 41 of 1175 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com on May 13, 2020).
